intro: Tibouchina serrana, commonly known as the Brazilian beauty or pink hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, which give it its scientific name. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Tibouchina serrana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
